meanings.definition: A permanent marker with a fine tip.
meanings.sent1: I used a sharpie to label my school supplies.
meanings.sent2: The teacher used a sharpie to write her name on the whiteboard.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally drew on my face with a sharpie and now I have a mustache.
meanings.sent4: Her words were like a sharpie, leaving a lasting impression on everyone.
meanings.sent5: The sharpie's ink was so bold and dark, it stood out on the paper.

meanings.definition: A person who is clever or quick-witted.
meanings.sent1: My grandpa is a sharpie when it comes to solving puzzles.
meanings.sent2: The detective in the movie was a sharpie at solving crimes.
meanings.sent3: The sharpie at the party always had a witty comeback ready.
meanings.sent4: She was a sharpie in negotiations, always getting the best deals.
meanings.sent5: The sharpie's quick thinking saved the day in the escape room challenge.
